17.heading: Terrorism.
17.title: Madwoman of the Sacred Heart
17.author: story by Alexandro Jodorowsky; art by Jean "Moebius" Giraud ; letters by Dave Cooper ; translated by Randy and Jean-Marc Lofficier.
notes: 1 v. : ill. ; 22 cm.
Translation of: Le Coeur Couronné 1: La Folie du Sacre-Coeur.

Summary: "In a world of narco-terrorism, fifty-second soundbites, and multi-national corporations, how would we deal with a new Savior? Would we, like the Romans, even be aware of the birth of a new Messiah? Could we tell the difference between John the Baptist and just another sect of nuts?"

123.heading: Terry.
123.title: "The Dog Show"
123.author: art: George Wilhelms
123.appears_in: 8 p. in Rangers of Freedom Comics, no. 2 (Dec. 1941).
notes: Introduces The Double-Slango Kids (Topper, Steve, and Terry), and Roughneck (a collie); villain Fatsie Smythe also introduced.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.

125.heading: Terry.
125.title: "The Phony Parachutist"
125.author: art: Jim Chambers? 9 p
125.appears_in: in Rangers of Freedom Comics, no. 1 (Oct. 1941).
notes: Introduces The Royal Watch (Jock, Mac, Harry and Terry), Sgt. Harkness, Capt. Carruthers; villains are Herman and other Nazi spies, who all die.
Data from Lou Mougin via The Grand Comics Database Project.
